# How to Verify the Structure & Integrity of Android & iOS Apps

Last updated June 10, 2024 by Appdome

Appdome’s App Integrity Validation allows you to easily verify the structure & integrity of Android & iOS apps. Whenever you upload an app to the Appdome platform, the system validates the integrity and structural components of the app automatically.  App Integrity validation can also be done by customers.

We hope you find it useful and enjoy using Appdome!

## How to Verify the Structure & Integrity of Android & iOS Apps

Appdome app integrity validation automatically validates your uploaded mobile app every time you upload an app to the platform. When a mobile app has been uploaded to the Appdome platform, Appdome inspects the app and examines the app structure to validate its integrity and ensure that it’s a valid .apk, .aab, or .ipa that has been correctly built.

Once activated, **Appdome Integrity Service** verifies the uploaded app has:

* Valid binary structures
* Valid binary file formats (info.plist and Android. manifest)
* Valid SDK versions
* Apple FairPlay breaches
* Legal bundle identifier patterns
* Deprecated file formats

In addition, the **Appdome Integrity Service** ensures that uploaded apps will run smoothly after you Fuse them with Appdome’s features and capabilities.

While fusing an app, Appdome automatically protects your app against debugging, tampering, reverse engineering, and a variety of other app-shielding features, all included in [Appdome ONEShield™](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/no-code-mobile-app-security/fusing-apps-with-oneshield-by-appdome/).

### Android Apps Requirements

Appdome requires a full .apk or .aab file to protect the entire app. By allowing “Android Bundle” or by implementing the app with the [isSplitRequired](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/R.attr.html#isSplitRequired) attribute, parts of the app build and feature modules can’t be obfuscated, encrypted, or protected by Appdome.

In addition, for Android apps, the uploaded app shouldn’t be exported in testOnly mode. To sign the full .apk file, when developing the app in Android Studio, Go to **Build** and **Generate Signed APK:**

![Generate Signed Bundle Apk](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Generate-Signed-Bundle-APK.png)

![Apk](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/APK.png)

## 3 Easy Steps to Verify the Structure & Integrity of Android & iOS Apps

Please follow these 3 easy steps to verify the structure & integrity of Android & iOS apps

1. [**Upload**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/begin-no-code-mobile-app-security-project/) an Android or iOS App to Appdome’s no-code security platform (.apk, .aab, or .ipa)
2. Appdome will automatically verify the structure and integrity of the app
3. Review the results.

The integrity service will thwart the app upload process if the app’s validity is malformed.  
For example:  
![Failure](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Failure.png)

When the app’s structure and integrity are verified, you will see this result.  
![Success](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/success.png)

Now you can proceed to the “Build” part of the [Appdome Mobile Integration Workflow](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/using-no-code-security-android-ios-apps/) and start adding features, SDKs, and APIs to build and secure your new app!
